intro: Ouratea oleifolia, commonly known as the oil tree or yellow ouratea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, fragrant yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Ouratea oleifolia thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is adapted to humid, shaded environments in its natural habitat.
